DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare effect low-carbohydrate diet high-carbohydrate , high-fiber diet , insulin sensitivity blood chemical consider risk marker heart disease , person metabolic syndrome . Our primary hypothesis ad libitum high-carbohydrate , high-fiber diet significantly improve insulin sensitivity , whereas ad libitum low-carbohydrate , low-fiber diet .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Two Different Diets Health Outcomes
DOC.detailed_description: Low-carbohydrate eat become perceived weight loss diet , rather mean improve health . Several study publish suggest low-carbohydrate diet may preferable low-fat diet weight loss term health marker . On hand , considerable evidence suggest low-carbohydrate diet , high fat , associate number adverse health outcome . The health benefit high-carbohydrate , high-fiber diet also demonstrate . This study design assess difference two different dietary strategy term number health outcome . Participants consume , random order , non-calorie-restricted low-carbohydrate non-calorie-restricted high-carbohydrate , high-fiber diet one month , 4-6 week washout period .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Subjects must meet criterion metabolic syndrome , define three follow : Waist circumference : > 94 cm male ; > 80 cm female Blood Pressure : > 130/85 mmHg HDLChol ( mg/dl ) : < 50 woman ; < 40 men ) Triglycerides ( mg/dl ) : > 150 Glucose ( mg/dl ) : > 100 2 . Subjects must meet age requirement 3 . Subjects must nonsmoker 4 . Subjects must willing provide write consent 5 . Subjects must willing pickup meal GCRC return uneaten food 6 . Have food allergy 7 . Subjects must currently follow particular diet , must intentionally lose weight diet previous 3 month 8 . Subjects must take nutritional supplement daily multivitamin 9 . Subjects must willing maintain current physical activity routine , exceed equivalent > 30 minute per day moderateintensity activity 10 . Blood hematocrit must least 40 men 36 woman . 1 . Does meet criterion metabolic syndrome 2 . Does meet age requirement 3 . Smoker 4 . Pregnancy 5 . Food allergies 6 . Unwillingness provide write consent 7 . Personal history cardiovascular disease , include prior myocardial infarction , angioplasty , bypass surgery 8 . Known cardiovascular metabolic disease ( e.g. , diabetes ) 9 . Currently use medication control blood pressure , lipid , glucose 10 . Currently diet attempt weight loss diet past 3 month 11 . Currently take nutritional supplement daily multivitamin 12 . Currently exercise equivalent 30 minutes/day moderateintensity physical activity 13 . Currently oral contraceptive 14 . Hematocrit 40 men 36 woman 15 . Baseline systolic blood pressure 100 mmHg
